column4: i am attempting to use usb-creator-gtk to make a bootable usb. but it keeps failing with
there is not enough free space for this image
the usb stick is 8gb. why is this happening?
is the usb full?
i don't believe so. i just use disk utiltity in osx to reformat it
what filesystem did it create?
using MSDOS "traditional" partition table?
i'm not sure. what do you suggest i use?
I'm blind-guessing here... osx is capable of gpt partition tables, and they may not be supported by usb-creator
and gpt might be the default format iin Disk Utility
try "format Drive" again, it should ask what partition table standard to use
under osx?
yes... I'm assuming you're using disk utility and usb-creator in osx, correct?
the options are 'guid pt', 'apple pt' or 'master boot record'
master boot record
thats what i've been using
ill try this again
so im actually using unetbootin under osx
so it appears to work but returns "the created usb device will not boot off a mac. insert it into a pc and select the usb boot option in the bios menu." is this normal?
hummm, mac *requires* gpt ?then I don't know man...
I'm not sure about the requirements for usb-creator in osx, sorry... not even sure IF usb-creator is able to hand non-mbr partition tables...
